results.title: Insan = Human being
results.creator_credit: Ibrahim Shaddad and S C Cinema
results.brief_description: This experimental film without dialogue makes innovative use of sound to tell the story of a shepherd who, having lost his wife, children and cattle after his homeland is stricken by drought, goes to the city to find work. Through a poetic association of images the film critiques the dehumanising effects on the Sudanese people of the Sharia ruled government that was in power in the early eighties.

results.title: Infield play at 1st and 3rd
results.creator_credit: American and National Leagues of Professional Baseball Clubs
results.brief_description: Instructional film for intending infield players at first and third base. Some very fine slow-motion footage reveals that wealth of delicate grace otherwise latent in baseball’s gymnastic protocols.

results.title: Infection control in the workplace
results.brief_description: This video and trainers guide is a simple to understand, effective package to help prevent blood borne diseases being transferred in any workplace situation involving blood.

results.title: India: an Introduction
results.creator_credit: James MacDonald, Michael Camerini, Sam Bryan and Worldview Productions
results.brief_description: Shows India as a nation varied in cultures, religions and customs, in climate, dress, diet, history, and language. Looks at industries and farming. Animated maps are used to locate the Himalayas, farmlands, paths of the monsoon rains, population density and India’s many alphabets and languages.

results.title: Independent living centre [Turkish Version]
results.brief_description: Outlines the highly specialised and unique services of the Independent Living Centre in Victoria which aims to assist people with disabilities to enhance their independence and quality of life by providing demonstrations, advice and information on a comprehensive range of aids and equipment for daily living. Narrated in Turkish.

results.title: In the crash
results.creator_credit: Leo Trachtenberg, Roger Reidy, Harvest Films and Insurance Institute for Highway Safety
results.brief_description: Despite ‘accident prevention’ campaigns, millions of cars continue to crash each year. This documentary argues that legislation needs to be introduced to address better safety standards in car and highway designs. Uses footage of highway crashes, controlled safety tests, and potential highway hazards to demonstrates how injury and property damage can be reduced through design. Demonstrates features designed to reduce personal injury such as seat belts, air bags, laminated windscreens, padded daashboards, shock absorbing steering columns, anchored seats and head rests. Also looks at highway design, demonstrating good and bad examples of traffic islands, barriers, signage poles and lamp posts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leo Trachtenberg, Roger Reidy, Harvest Films and Insurance Institute for Highway Safety
